channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for Friday 14 August
item.description: The South Waikato town of Tokoroa has two confirmed cases of Covid-19 and five probable cases, according to councillors. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest updates.

item.title: Covid-19: Lack of testing of staff at border 'extraordinary' - Skegg
item.description: The lack of testing of staff at the border is extraordinary, a prominent epidemiologist says.

item.title: How New Zealanders are reacting to the Covid-19 alert level changes
item.description: New Zealanders outside of Auckland are filled with anxiety, frustration and a touch of apathy as they grapple with the possibility of returning to life under level 3 or even level 4 restrictions.

item.title: ECE centres fear financial impact of extended Auckland Covid-19 lockdown
item.description: Auckland early learning centre owners say they can't survive without parents' fees and they would need government support if attendance was banned for an extended period.

item.title: Phil Goff: Auckland will need more government help
item.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff says if the city was to go back into alert level 4 it would need government assistance.

item.title: Police raids uncover banned forearms in Porirua, Lower Hutt
item.description: Police raids on two properties with gang links in the Wellington region have uncovered illegal firearms, including a banned AR-15 semi-automatic assault rifle.

item.title: Woman had to queue for Covid-19 test with other symptomatic people
item.description: A woman tested at an Auckland pop-up clinic had to queue in a tent with other symptomatic people - with little social distancing and hardly anyone wearing a mask.

item.title: Aucklanders not optimistic Covid-19 alert level 3 will end tonight
item.description: The return to alert level 3 has put Aucklanders back in their bubbles, and they will find out if the lockdown is extended at 5.30pm today.

item.title: New cluster spreads to North Shore school
item.description: A primary school student on Auckland's North Shore has tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown extension likely - disease modelling expert
item.description: As health officials race to track the the origins of the community outbreak of Covid-19 as the cluster hits 17 cases, disease modeller Shaun Hendy says a lockdown extension is likely.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Huge risk' people won't trust vaccines - expert
item.description: Fears about the safety of a vaccine for Covid-19 could put people off receiving it and see the country fall short of achieving herd immunity.

item.title: Timeline of New Zealand's newest Covid-19 community transmission cluster
item.description: This timeline charts the movements of New Zealand's newest Covid-19 cluster, the actions of health authorities and the government response.

item.title: Taranaki leaders urge Defence Force to secure region's borders from Covid-19
item.description: The Taranaki Mayoral Forum and the Taranaki Iwi Chairs' Forum say it's their collective view "we must create a Taranaki bubble to protect our people and our economy".

item.title: Jury finds man not guilty of murder in Porirua brawl
item.description: A jury has found a man not guilty of murder after a brawl in Porirua resulted in a man dying from several stab wounds.

item.title: Police officer self-isolating after contact with Covid-19 positive case
item.description: A Waikato police officer is isolating after being in contact with a Covid-19 positive case. And in Auckland a disqualified driver fled from one of checkpoints but was not chased after.

item.title: Health minister Chris Hipkins discusses efforts to find 'patient zero'
item.description: Minister for health Chris Hipkins says it is not known who patient zero from the latest cluster is but genome testing suggests the strain of Covid-19 originated in the United Kingdom or Australia.

item.title: Rules for water activities in levels 2 and 3
item.description: Aucklanders are prohibited from using their boats for recreational use during alert level 3.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened on 13 August
item.description: Auckland's testing record has been smashed as more cases are detected in the community. Tomorrow the country will find out about any further alert level changes.
